Overview on predefined tasks

overview.Rmd

Before creating your own tasks, you might want to explore the predefined tasks available in the quallmer package. These tasks are designed to streamline common annotation needs and can be easily integrated into your workflow.

Predefined tasks

The quallmer package currently includes the following predefined tasks:

  • Sentiment analysis: The sentiment() task allows you to rate the sentiment of texts on a scale from -1 (very negative) to 1 (very positive), along with a brief explanation.

  • Thematic coding: The themes() task helps identify and categorize themes within textual data.

  • Stance detection: The stance() task assesses the stance of a text towards a specific topic or issue.

If you wish to create custom tasks tailored to your specific research questions and data types, you can use the define_task() function. This function allows you to specify the system prompt and output structure, enabling you to customize the annotation process according to your needs.

Developed by Seraphine F. Maerz, Kenneth Benoit.
